snippet: Away from the protests in the run-up to a referendum Saturday on a constitution, residents of the crumbling Boulaq neighborhood of Cairo have their own reasons to be consumed with the crisis.
abstract: Residents of Boulaq, impoverished Cairo neighborhood, feel growing disappointment with Pres Mohamed Morsi, his Muslim Brotherhood supporters and leaders of opposition; find their hopes dashed that country's new leadership will provide for the poor, and say   Morsi's disregard has been harder to take than that of former leader, Hosni Mubarak.
lead_paragraph: Away from the protests in the run-up to a referendum Saturday on a constitution, residents of the crumbling Boulaq neighborhood of Cairo have their own reasons to be consumed with the crisis.

headline.seo: In Cairo Crisis, Unheard Voice From the Poor
headline.main: In Cairo Crisis, the Poor Find Dashed Hopes
headline.print_headline: In Cairo Crisis, The Poor Find Dashed Hopes
